p: At a regional scale, a linear increase in both wetland area (+1.15 km 2/yr, R 2 = 0.72, p < 0.001) and wetland number (+37.4 wetlands/yr, R 2 = 0.76, p < 0.001) was evidenced since 1984 ( Fig 3). This equals to an estimated increase of 300°% in wetland surface area and 218°% increase in wetland number in 30 years. We also found a strong inter-annual variability in both wetland surface area and number, and a strong positive correlation between these two variables (slope = 3.0, R 2 = 0.93, p < 0.001; Fig 4A). While the total surface area of wetlands significantly increased over the last 30 years, the distribution of individual wetland size showed no detectable temporal trend in mean and median values. However, we observed a barely significant increase in the top-quartile values of individual wetland surface area over time (slope = 0.8, R 2 = 0.32, p = 0.076; Fig 4B).
